definition: you can't guard against it (idiom)/impossible to defend effectively/not much one can do about it/It can't be prevented.
to protect/to defend/to guard against/to prevent
(negative prefix)/not/no

victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)
to protect/to defend/to guard against/to prevent

sentences.english: Various deceptive means are hardly preventable.
sentences.chinese: 各种各样的忽悠手段是防不胜防的。

sentences.english: Site send patrols every night, but the thief is still very hard to detect.
sentences.chinese: 工地每天晚上都派人巡逻，但是小偷还是防不胜防。

sentences.english: Road section collapses into 5-meter long hole .
sentences.chinese: 上海突现路面塌陷“坑”来横祸防不胜防。

sentences.english: The problem, however, is that enumeration can be arbitrarily complex.
sentences.chinese: 然而问题在于这种枚举的复杂性防不胜防。

sentences.english: A valiant attempt to defend her babies does not deter these assailants.
sentences.chinese: 虽然它极力保护孩子，袭击者依旧防不胜防。

sentences.english: Critics say the risk of a potentially toxic food supply is untenable.
sentences.chinese: 批评者则说，食物供给可能有毒的风险防不胜防。

definition: lit. to appear and disappear unpredictably like a spirit or a ghost (idiom)/fig. elusive
more and more emerge/innumerable succession/breeding like flies (idiom)
no time to deal with it (idiom); caught unprepared
senior high school enrollment
to get infected/to fall into sb's trap
trick/deceit
to have an opportunity that one can exploit (idiom)
move (in chess, on stage, in martial arts)/gambit/trick/scheme/movement/same as 著數|着数[zhao1 shu4]
more than one can attend to (idiom)/deluged (with inquiries etc)/overwhelmed (by the beauty of the scenery)
unimaginable/outrageous/freakish
changeable/changing/varied/full of changes
not expected at the outset (idiom)/unforeseen/to be surprised by the turn of events
hard to distinguish real from imitation
unpredictable/changeable
lit. easy to dodge the spear in the open, hard to avoid a stab in the dark (idiom); it is hard to guard against secret conspiracies
pinyin: ming2 qiang1 yi4 duo3 , an4 jian4 nan2 fang2

definition: hard to tell if it's real or sham
virtue is one foot tall, the devil ten foot (idiom); It takes constant vigilance to stave off evil.
pinyin: dao4 gao1 yi1 chi3 , mo2 gao1 yi1 zhang4
